flask_app.backend package¶

Submodules¶

flask_app.backend.courses module¶

class flask_app.backend.courses.APIGet¶

Bases: object

Static class which handles API calls to retrieve course/section info.

static get_complete_course_by_course_code(course_code: str) → flask_app.backend.courses.Course¶

Gets a complete course (with sections) given its course code. To be used when adding a course to the schedule.

Parameters

course_code – str Course code of the course to be gotten.

Returns

Course

Course returned by combined responses of planetterp and umd.io APIs

Return type

course

static get_course_head_by_course_code(course_code: str) → flask_app.backend.courses.Course¶

Gets a course “head” (without sections) given its course code. Helper method of get_course_heads_by_query and get_complete_course_by_course_code.

Parameters

course_code – str Course code of the course to be gotten.

Returns

Course

Course returned by planetterp API, without sections. Will have rating info, etc.

Return type

course

static get_course_heads_by_query(query: str) → list¶

Gets a list of courses (without sections) that match a given query. To be used when searching for a course to be added to schedule.

Parameters

query – str Search string to search on planetterp

Returns

list[Course]

List of courses that were found by this search, without sections. (Course “heads”)

Return type

found_courses

static get_course_list_by_page_number(page_num: int) → dict¶

Given a page number, this function will call the API and give back a dictionary of course objects in alphabetical order in order to display them all on the “see all courses” page Each page has 30 courses

:
page_num: int

The page number of all courses to load

Returns

dict

Dictionary of courses in alphabetical order to display in the “all courses” page (max of 30)

Return type

courses

headers = {'Accept': 'application/json'}¶
class flask_app.backend.courses.APIParse¶

Bases: object

Static class which parses API responses. Extract their contents using .json() before calling this class.

static planetterp_course_raw_to_course_head(course_raw: dict) → flask_app.backend.courses.Course¶

Makes a response from planetterp’s course get into a course (with no sections)

Parameters

Returns

Return type

class flask_app.backend.courses.Course(course_code: str, name: str, course_credits: int, sections: dict, professor_to_sections: dict, professor_to_avg_course_gpa: dict, avg_gpa: any = 0)¶

Bases: object

Represents a course as seen on the Schedule of Classes. Contains a list of sections, the course code, and credits.

class flask_app.backend.courses.CourseList¶

Bases: object

Class containing a list of all courses available to add.

static get_course_using_course_code(course_code: str) → flask_app.backend.courses.Course¶

Given a course code (e.g. CMSC131) this function will call the umd.io API and give back a Course object This function will raise an exception if the course code or sections information cannot be found on the API (status code from response is not 200)

Parameters

course_code – str String of the course code (e.g. cmsc131)

Returns

Course

Returns a Course object corresponding with the course code string

Return type

course

static get_courses_using_page_number(page_num: int) → dict¶

Given a page number, this function will call the API and give back a dictionary of course objects in alphabetical order in order to display them all on the “see all courses” page Each page has 30 courses

Parameters

page_num – int The page number of all courses to load

Returns

dict

Returns a dictionary of course objects (maximum of 30) to be displayed in the all courses tab

Return type

courses

static make_meeting_dict(meetings_list: list, section_id: str, course: flask_app.backend.courses.Course) → dict¶
Parameters

  • meetings_list – list[dict] List of dict representations of meeting times to be converted to a dict of MeetingTimes.

  • section_id – str The section_id of the section

  • course – Course The parent Course of the section

Returns

Dict mapping day of the week “M”, “Tu”, etc to a list of MeetingTime objects (in order).

Return type

weekly_schedule

class flask_app.backend.courses.MeetingTime(meeting: dict, section_id: str, course: flask_app.backend.courses.Course)¶

Bases: object

Class representing a single time-slot of a section. Contains time, location, and section id.

class flask_app.backend.courses.RequestProxy¶

Bases: object

Handles sending requests to the API. Can be set to emulate the API in order to complete tests. Set test_mode = True. Emulation consists of returning the sample responses listed on the respective APIs. Returns error sample response when bad_request is set to True.

bad_request = False¶

class flask_app.backend.courses.Section(course_code: str, section_id: str, total_seats: int, open_seats: int, class_meetings: dict, professor: list, course: flask_app.backend.courses.Course, is_synchronous: bool)¶

Bases: object

Represents an individual section of a course. Contains course code, section id, total and open seats, and other information for the schedule builder itself such as color to be displayed.

get_formatted_weekly_schedule() → dict¶
Returns

dict[str, str]

Dict of nicely formatted section info to be used on the course list. Keys are strings of format “9AM-10:15AM”, etc. Values are strings of format “MWF”, “TuTh”, etc.

Return type

weekly_schedule

flask_app.backend.schedule module¶

class flask_app.backend.schedule.MySchedule¶

Bases: object

Representation of the user’s schedule. Contains a list of sections, the number of credits, meeting times for each day, and any important warnings about the schedule.

class ScheduleWarning(involved_sections: list, warning_type: str)¶

Bases: object

Warning message to be displayed next to the user’s schedule, when their schedule has some notable issue.

get_schedule_average_gpa() → float¶

Calculates average GPA of the current schedule

get_serialized_schedule() → str¶

This function serializes the user’s schedule to easily be copied by the user on the frontend. The user can then use this serialized string to load their schedule through the “load_serialized_schedule” function.

Returns

str

A String representation of the user’s schedule

Return type

str_schedule

load_serialized_schedule(str_schedule: str) → None¶

This function takes a string representation of the serialized version of a user’s schedule and loads this schedule by adding all of the sections/meeting times.

param:
str_schedule: str

A String representation of the user’s schedule generated from the get_serialized_schedule function

remove_all_classes() → None¶

Resets the schedule to be empty. TODO Fix for new course/section addition procedure
